abstract.p: Fund for Stockowners Rights chairman Carl Olson letter decries omission of mention of stock owners in July 23 article on desired qualities for corporate directors

block.p: How depressing to read an article about the desired qualities for corporate directors with no mention whatsoever of the words ''stock owner.'' (''So You Want to Become a Corporate Director,'' Personal Business, July 23).

How depressing to read an article about the desired qualities for corporate directors with no mention whatsoever of the words ''stock owner.'' (''So You Want to Become a Corporate Director,'' Personal Business, July 23).

In the discussion, we learn of the importance of the good-old-boy/girl network of cronyism in gaining a spot on a corporate board, but nothing about the primary responsibility of directors to represent the stock owners' interest.

Whatever happened to improving profitability, increasing return on investment, boosting dividends, jettisoning lackadaisical management, resisting deceptive accounting procedures, lobbying for deregulation and tax cuts, devising creative acquisitions and divestments and generating positive excitement in the investing world?
Now that would be a dynamite corporate director!
CARL OLSON Woodland Hills, Calif., July 23
The writer is the chairman of the Fund for Stockowners Rights.
